# init(forReadingFrom:)

**Initializer**

Initializes an archiver to decode data from the specified location.

## Declaration

```swift
init(forReadingFrom data: Data) throws
```

## Parameters

- **data**: An archive previously encoded by [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSKeyedArchiver].

## Discussion

This initializer enables [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSKeyedUnarchiver/requiresSecureCoding] by default, and sets the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSKeyedUnarchiver/decodingFailurePolicy] to [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSCoder/DecodingFailurePolicy-swift.enum/setErrorAndReturn].

Call [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSKeyedUnarchiver/finishDecoding()] when you finish decoding data

This method throws an error if `data` isn’t a valid keyed archive.



## Creating a Keyed Unarchiver

- **init()**: Initializes an archiver to decode data.
- **init(forReadingWith:)**: Initializes an archiver to decode data from the specified location.
